name: app.R
content:
library(shiny)
library(ggplot2)

ui <- fluidPage(
  h2("Interact with the Plot"),
  p("Click and drag on the plot to filter the table below."),
  
  # The plot with a 'brush' ID
  plotOutput("plot", brush = "plot_brush"),
  
  hr(),
  
  # Standard Shiny HTML table output
  tableOutput("table")
)

server <- function(input, output) {
  
  # Render the ggplot
  output$plot <- renderPlot({
    ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = mpg, y = disp)) +
      geom_point(color = "steelblue", size = 3) +
      theme_minimal()
  })
  
  # Render the standard HTML table based on brushed points
  output$table <- renderTable({
    res <- brushedPoints(mtcars, input$plot_brush)
    
    # If no points are selected, you can return a message or an empty data frame
    if (nrow(res) == 0) {
      return(NULL)
    }
    
    # Display the filtered data
    res
  }, 
  # Optional: styling the HTML table
  striped = TRUE, 
  hover = TRUE, 
  bordered = TRUE)
}

shinyApp(ui = ui, server = server)
